Registered commands will be available from the @<!-- -->{<!-- -->link https://help.md/Plugins/Command+palette Command palette<!-- -->}<!-- -->. The command id and name will be automatically prefixed with this plugin's id and name. |
|  [`addRibbonIcon(icon, title, callback)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/addRibbonIcon.md) |  | Adds a ribbon icon to the left bar. |
|  [`addSettingTab(settingTab)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/addSettingTab.md) |  | Register a settings tab, which allows users to change settings. |
|  [`addStatusBarItem()`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/addStatusBarItem.md) |  | Adds a status bar item to the bottom of the app. Not available on mobile. |

|  [`onExternalSettingsChange()?`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/onExternalSettingsChange.md) |  | <p>_(Optional)_ Called when the <code>data.json</code> file is modified on disk externally from Obsidian. This usually means that a Sync service or external program has modified the plugin settings.</p><p>Implement this method to reload plugin settings when they have changed externally.</p> |

|  [`onUserEnable()`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/onUserEnable.md) |  | Perform any initial setup code. The user has explicitly interacted with the plugin so its safe to engage with the user. If your plugin registers a custom view, you can open it here. |
|  [`register(cb)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/register.md) |  | <p>Registers a callback to be called when unloading</p><p>(Inherited from [Component](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component.md)<!-- -->)</p> |

|  [`registerEditorExtension(extension)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/registerEditorExtension.md) |  | Registers a CodeMirror 6 extension. To reconfigure cm6 extensions for a plugin on the fly, an array should be passed in, and modified dynamically. Once this array is modified, calling [Workspace.updateOptions()](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Workspace/updateOptions.md) will apply the changes. |
|  [`registerEditorSuggest(editorSuggest)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/registerEditorSuggest.md) |  | Register an EditorSuggest which can provide live suggestions while the user is typing. |
|  [`registerEvent(eventRef)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/registerEvent.md) |  | <p>Registers an event to be detached when unloading</p><p>(Inherited from [Component](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component.md)<!-- -->)</p> |

|  [`registerHoverLinkSource(id, info)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/registerHoverLinkSource.md) |  | Registers a view with the 'Page preview' core plugin as an emitter of the 'hover-link' event. |
|  [`registerInterval(id)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component/registerInterval.md) |  | <p>Registers an interval (from setInterval) to be cancelled when unloading Use  instead of  to avoid TypeScript confusing between NodeJS vs Browser API</p><p>(Inherited from [Component](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Component.md)<!-- -->)</p> |
|  [`registerMarkdownCodeBlockProcessor(language, handler, sortOrder)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/registerMarkdownCodeBlockProcessor.md) |  | Register a special post processor that handles fenced code given a language and a handler. This special post processor takes care of removing the <code>&lt;pre&gt;&lt;code&gt;</code> and create a <code>&lt;div&gt;</code> that will be passed to the handler, and is expected to be filled with custom elements. |
|  [`registerMarkdownPostProcessor(postProcessor, sortOrder)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/registerMarkdownPostProcessor.md) |  | Registers a post processor, to change how the document looks in reading mode. |

|  [`removeCommand(commandId)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/removeCommand.md) |  | Manually remove a command from the list of global commands. This should not be needed unless your plugin registers commands dynamically. |
|  [`saveData(data)`](03%20Documentation/TypeScript%20API/Plugin/saveData.md) |  | Write settings data to disk. Data is stored in <code>data.json</code> in the plugin folder. |
